item.title: 印度寻求重振高速公路的私人投资
item.description: 印度正努力吸引私人资本重返高速公路建设领域，此前因担忧收益风险和官僚拖延，投资者已撤离该领域十年之久。【原文：India is working to lure private capital back into highway construction, a decade after investors retreated over concerns about revenue risks and bureaucratic delays.】

item.title: 马来西亚经济意外强劲增长推动2026年预测上调
item.description: 马来西亚上季度远超预期的经济增长，促使众多分析师纷纷上调今年经济增长预期，部分预测认为这个东南亚国家将再次超越官方预测。【原文：Malaysia’s much better-than-expected growth last quarter has prompted a flurry of analyst upgrades to their forecasts for this year, with some predicting the Southeast Asian nation will once again outperform official projections.】

item.title: 黑石将领投6亿美元投资人工智能公司Neysa
item.description: 由黑石集团牵头的投资者团体计划对印度人工智能云初创企业Neysa进行最高6亿美元的股权投资。【原文：A group of investors led by Blackstone Inc. plans to make an equity investment of up to $600 million in India’s artificial intelligence cloud startup Neysa.】

item.title: 日本债券市场迎来转机：高市早苗胜选后，Jupiter’s Nash公司转投日本债券
item.description: 木星资产管理公司的马克·纳什首次对日本政府债券价格上涨作出长期战略性押注。【原文：For the first time ever, Jupiter Asset Management’s Mark Nash is placing a long-term, strategic bet that Japanese government bonds will rise.】

item.title: 涉及610亿美元债务的合并将助力印度信贷市场
item.description: 印度电力行业贷款机构近日宣布合并，这为全球增长最快的主要经济体注入了新的希望——能源及其他关键驱动领域有望获得更多融资支持。【原文：A recently announced merger of Indian lenders to the power sector is fueling hope that financing will get a boost for energy and other key drivers of the world’s fastest growing major economy.】

item.title: 日本经济增长乏力，高市早苗关注支出
item.description: 2025年第四季度日本经济产出远低于预期，在上一季度大幅萎缩后仅录得微弱增长，这进一步凸显了首相高市早苗在选举胜利后推行积极支出政策的必要性。【原文：Japan’s economic output in the fourth quarter of 2025 was much weaker than expected, registering anemic growth after a deep contraction in the previous period, underscoring the case for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s proactive spending policies following her election triumph.】

item.title: 油价持稳，伊朗谈判前聚焦地缘政治风险
item.description: 本周初油价基本持平，交易员们密切关注地缘政治风险，因美伊谈判预计将于周二重启。【原文：Oil was little changed at the start of the week, as traders monitored geopolitical risk before talks between the US and Iran are expected to resume on Tuesday.】

item.title: 金价小幅回落，交易员锁定每盎司5000美元上方收益
item.description: 金价回落，因美国温和的通胀数据推动金价重回每盎司5000美元上方后，交易员纷纷获利了结。【原文：Gold slipped, as traders booked profits after mild US inflation data pushed the metal back above $5,000 an ounce.】

item.title: OpenAI聘请OpenClaw人工智能代理开发者彼得·斯坦伯格
item.description: 彼得·斯坦伯格，知名开源人工智能程序OpenClaw的创建者，即将加入OpenAI公司，助力这家ChatGPT开发者的产品阵容。【原文：Peter Steinberger, creator of popular open-source artificial intelligence program OpenClaw, will be joining OpenAI Inc. to help bolster the ChatGPT developer’s product offerings.】

item.title: 麦格理牵头的财团同意以83亿美元收购Qube控股公司
item.description: 由麦格理资产管理公司牵头的财团将以约117亿澳元（83亿美元）收购Qube控股有限公司。此次收购将使这家澳大利亚企业旗下庞大的基础设施资产版图新增港口与铁路运营商业务。【原文：A group led by Macquarie Asset Management will buy Qube Holdings Ltd. in a deal worth around A$11.7 billion ($8.3 billion), as the Australian firm adds a ports and rail operator to its vast swath of infrastructure assets.】

item.title: 日本家族奋力争夺157年老字号企业控制权
item.description: 石川县是毗邻日本海的偏远山区县，但一家自1869年便扎根当地的连锁药店命运，却牵动着数百公里外的东京金融市场。【原文：Ishikawa is a remote, mountainous prefecture bordering the Sea of Japan, but the fate of a drug store chain whose local roots go back to 1869 has implications for Tokyo’s financial markets hundreds of kilometers away.】

item.title: 人工智能对内存的狂热需求正加剧日益严重的芯片危机
item.description: 包括埃隆·马斯克和蒂姆·库克在内的科技行业领袖正不断发出警告：一场全球性危机正在酝酿——内存芯片短缺已开始重创企业利润、打乱经营计划，并推高从笔记本电脑、智能手机到汽车、数据中心等各类产品的价格标签。而这场危机只会愈演愈烈。【原文：A growing procession of tech industry leaders including Elon Musk and Tim Cook are warning about a global crisis in the making: A shortage of memory chips is beginning to hammer profits, derail corporate plans and inflate price tags on everything from laptops and smartphones to automobiles and data centers — and the crunch is only going to get worse.】

item.title: 英国工党领袖斯塔默要求人工智能聊天机器人遵守网络安全规则
item.description: 英国首相基尔·斯塔默正严厉打击传播有害内容的人工智能聊天机器人，承诺确保它们遵守旨在保护儿童网络安全的法律。【原文：UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is cracking down on AI chatbots sharing harmful content, pledging to ensure they comply with laws designed to protect children online.】

item.title: 亚洲股市有望上涨，因美国CPI提振市场情绪：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市周一有望上涨，此前美国股市近期抛售压力缓解，通胀数据也支持了美联储今年降息的前景。【原文：Asian equities were poised to rise Monday after recent selling pressure in US stocks eased and inflation data supported the outlook for Federal Reserve rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 数据黑洞使政策制定者在追查下一次崩盘时“盲目飞行”
item.description:
私募市场的兴起模糊了监管机构和经济学家用于识别全球经济风险的数据。 

【原文：

The rise of private markets has obscured data which regulators and economists rely on to identify risks in the global economy. 

】

item.title: 盈利超预期推动澳股银行板块创2022年以来最佳单周表现
item.description: 澳大利亚银行股在财报表现优于预期推动下，创下近四年最大单周涨幅。【原文：Australian banking shares capped their biggest weekly jump in almost four years on better-than-expected earnings updates.】

item.title: 普拉博沃怒斥市场暴跌，印尼社会分化加剧
item.description:
印度尼西亚总统下令解雇监管人员，此前关于MSCI担忧的警告未被重视。【原文：

Indonesia’s president ordered the firings of regulators after warnings about MSCI’s concerns went unheeded.

】

item.title: a2牛奶上调营收预期，中国配方奶粉销量增长
item.description: 新西兰婴幼儿配方奶粉分销商a2 Milk公司上半年盈利增长，并上调全年营收预期，因其在中国的销售持续走强。【原文：New Zealand infant formula distributor a2 Milk boosted first-half earnings and raised full-year revenue guidance as sales in China continue to strengthen.】

item.title: 债券交易员关注就业数据与股市动向，检验涨势是否稳固
item.description: 美国债券交易员本周将密切关注股市走势及非农就业数据等经济指标，以判断国债市场的反弹是否具有可持续性。【原文：US bond traders will be watching the trajectory of stocks this week and economic releases such as private payrolls data to see whether the rally in Treasuries has legs.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟考虑重启与派拉蒙的收购谈判
item.description: 知情人士透露，华纳兄弟探索公司正考虑在收到敌意收购方最新修订的收购要约后，重启与好莱坞竞争对手派拉蒙天舞公司的出售谈判。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery Inc. is considering reopening sale talks with rival Hollywood studio Paramount Skydance Corp. after receiving its hostile suitor’s most recent amended offer, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 匈牙利寻求经克罗地亚运输俄罗斯原油，部长称
item.description: 匈牙利要求克罗地亚允许俄罗斯原油通过亚得里亚海管道运输，而穿越乌克兰的关键路线仍处于封锁状态。【原文：Hungary requested that Croatia allow the shipment of Russian crude via the Adriatic pipeline while a key route through Ukraine remains blocked.】

item.title: 特朗普制裁主管因与贝森特关系紧张即将离职
item.description: 据知情人士透露，特朗普政府首席制裁官员约翰·赫尔利因与财政部长斯科特·贝森特产生摩擦，即将离职。【原文：John Hurley, the Trump administration’s top sanctions official, is set to leave his post after friction with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 以色列通胀降至2021年以来最低水平，谢克尔汇率强势反弹
item.description: 以色列1月份通胀率放缓至疫情引发通胀飙升前的水平，降至2021年6月以来的最低点。【原文：Israel’s inflation slowed in January to levels not seen since before the pandemic-induced flare-up, falling to its lowest mark since June 2021.】

item.title: 汽油短缺的加州正转向巴哈马的燃料
item.description: 美国汽油正被运往国外，经巴哈马群岛辗转数千英里后，最终抵达加利福尼亚州——该州正面临炼油产能萎缩和油价高企的困境。【原文：US supplies of gasoline are being shipped out of the country to travel thousands of miles via the Bahamas before finally ending up in California, a state battling shrinking fuelmaking capacity and high pump prices.】

item.title: 期权交易所欲废除"毫无意义"的收费模式
item.description: 美国股票期权交易所正寻求改变监管费用的收取方式，试图摆脱延续数十年的惯例——该惯例允许它们收取在竞争对手交易所进行的交易费用。【原文：US equity options exchanges are seeking to change the way that regulatory fees are charged, moving away from a decades-old practice that allows them to pick up fees for business transacted on rival bourses.】

item.title: 股市末日循环正冲击着所有与人工智能相关的领域
item.description: 人工智能行业引发的股市动荡，折射出两种日益尖锐的矛盾担忧。【原文：The stock market turmoil unleashed by the artificial-intelligence industry reflects two fears that are increasingly at odds.】

item.title: 套利交易与大宗商品使新兴市场货币比七国集团货币更稳定
item.description: 新兴市场货币正展现出比发达国家货币更强的稳定性，部分投资者认为这一趋势可能成为二十多年来持续时间最长的稳定期。【原文：Emerging-market currencies are proving more stable than those in developed nations, a streak some investors say could become the longest in more than two decades.】

item.title: 特斯拉CarPlay受限于苹果iOS 26系统普及度不足
item.description: 特斯拉计划在其车辆中支持CarPlay的功能因iOS 26地图应用的改版需求而受阻。此外：苹果在重塑Siri的过程中遭遇新障碍；iOS 27系统新细节曝光；即将推出的低价版MacBook带来趣味消息。【原文：Tesla’s plan to start supporting CarPlay in its vehicles has been held back by the need for changes in iOS 26’s Maps app. Also: Apple hits fresh snags with its attempt to revamp Siri; new details on iOS 27; and some fun news about the upcoming low-cost MacBook.】

item.title: 黎巴嫩有信心能与国际货币基金组织就复苏计划弥合分歧
item.description: 黎巴嫩总理表示，其政府能够克服与国际货币基金组织在拟议法案上的分歧。该法案将允许储户追回被困在该国陷入困境的银行业中的数十亿美元资金。【原文：Lebanon’s premier said his government can overcome differences with the International Monetary Fund over a proposed law that would let depositors recover billions of dollars trapped in the country’s beleaguered banking sector.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德反对通过增税阻止资本外流
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜·拉加德表示，与征收税收相比，为欧洲投资创造激励措施是防止资本外流至其他地区的更佳途径。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said creating incentives for investments in Europe is a better approach to prevent capital outflows to other regions than imposing taxes.】
